Key Match Events: Amartey (43') and Ayew (90+2') scored for Ghana, while Benjamin (0'), Amutenya (38'), and Ndisiro (90+2') scored for Namibia
Pre-Game Insights: Ghana go into AFCON 2023 as one of the outsiders for the trophy, despite reigning supreme on the continent four times in 1963, 1965, 1978, and 1982.
Chris Hughton hopes to be the man to deliver the West African nation's fifth crown.
Namibia's Collin Benjamin's troops have never made it out of the group stage at the continental showpiece but could turn the tide this time in the Ivory Coast.
Ghana have been beaten in three of their last four games in all competitions, even if fans will state that two losses came in friendlies against Mexico (2-0) and the USA.
The Black Stars hope to have that winning feeling before their continental showpiece opener against Cape Verde.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Baba Yara Stadium in Kumasi, Ghana.
Ghana's forward line could feature Athletic Club's Inaki Williams, Crystal Palace's Jordan Ayew, and Bournemouth's Antoine Semenyo.
Peter Shalulie, who netted four goals, was Namibia's top performer in AFCON qualifying, and the striker should start in Monday's friendly.
Our expert tipster partners at Sporita.com are predicting under 3.5 goals in this match.
Others: Ghana's possible starting lineup: Ofori; Seidu, Djiku, Opoku, Mensah; Samed, Baba; Williams, Kudus, J. Ayew; Semenyo
Namibia's possible starting lineup: Maova; Nyambe, Haoseb, Gebhardt, Hanamub; Papama, Katua; Kamatuka, Muzeu, Limbondi; Shalulile
